comment: Didn't teach ANYTHING! You're forced to teach yourself outdated material. Incompetent. Penalized students on assignments with incorrect source code/assignments that didn't work properly and later corrected. Rude and blamed students for assignment not working properly. Gave a condescending lecture about "the real world". DONT take this professor!

This professor does not care about his students. Mistakes? Don't make them. You could tell him you lost both limbs in a car wreck and he wouldn't give any slack. This class is a self teaching class with little-to-no guidance. Don't expect to receive any help over email either. I put that I will make a C but I'm truly thinking I'll fail.

Wouldn't recommend. Encourages questions but responses can be vague and seem impatient. Instructions also tend to be vague but forces self-learning - I learned a lot by myself. Textbook's free online, but you'll have to find the weekly reading yourself based off the lecture. Weekly quiz, 4 labs, 3 papers, midterm, and final project (no final).

I signed up for another prof but KSU decided to switch professors on us. However, prof Prettyman responds back quick and is clear on his grading. Do the work follow his instruction yoi will succeed without a headache. Better than Jamie Jamison!

He is an adjunct professor with no recent professional experience in web development, but is unfortunately my professor for all web dev classes. He uses outdated material that isn't his, and he grades harshly, often not even using his own rubric for grading. If you have no prior experience in web development, he isn't the professor for you.

Though Grader, Not worth taking. To pass his class, simply memorize the whole book,  Exams are Very hard, you can score 100% on all Quizzes and Labs, but still fail the class. I won't recommend anyone ( If you not a genius ) to take his class. He is Careless, No Compassion for students, i failed his class by 1 pt. While i graduated with 3.4 GPA,
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Prof has little experience in coding.  ABSOLUTELY 0 care for his students, very cut & dry. HW assignments often unclear instructions.  Take this course if you're already familiar with Javascript & CSS.  No guidance, just pre-fab/ copied Power point slides and responses such as "read the book".  Lives in Key West,  acts like he's on 24/7 vacation.
Beware - the TEST/EXAMS are fill in the blank. Often times I would get the answer right, but not worded the way he wanted them to be worded. So he would mark it incorrect or give partial credit.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Here's the thing about Steve Prettyman, his class was hard but he is pretty rude when it comes to asking for help, or any questions at all to be honest, he clearly was not prepared for this semester, he told us the Final was proctored he did not give us a code for Proctor U until a couple days before the proctored final was due.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: For a 3 thousand level class, there was literally an over kill on the amount of homework required. Grading was a little harsh, and need to make sure that you have the topics memorized for accuracy. If you are taking this teacher, be ready for all proctored exams and 20 min for 20 questions quizzes (which is not enough time for a slow reader).
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS
